pageContext.description: A portion of the wood shaft remains in the socket. The holes shown in sketch are on the other side.
pageContext.patina: Only the remains of a patina - dark brown.
pageContext.surface: Fairly smooth, but rather pitted all over.
pageContext.other: Width: blade 41mm; socket end of blade 23mm,Thickness: blade 13mm,Weight: 111.03 gms
pageContext.associations: Part of a Bronze Founder's Hoard which included Bars of Gold.
pageContext.publications: Arch. XV, 118,Ant. Journ., Vol VIII, 1928, p. 40 and Pl XIII, Miss. L. F. Chitty
pageContext.collection: Society of Antiquaries, No. 4,Burlington House W.,Presented by Rev. Malachy Hitchins, 1802,B49 (ii)
pageContext.remarks: Miss Chitty suggests that this is really part of the Willow Moor Hoard (see Anti. Journ. 1928)
